member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectLoader
member.summary: An API for loading msbuild project files.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectLoader.#ctor(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Workspace,System.Collections.Immutable.ImmutableDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Create a new instance of an .
member.param: The workspace whose services this should use.

An optional dictionary of additional MSBuild properties and values to use when loading projects. These are the same properties that are passed to msbuild via the /property:<n>=<v> command line argument.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectLoader.Properties
member.summary: The MSBuild properties used when interpreting project files. These are the same properties that are passed to msbuild via the /property:<n>=<v> command line argument.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectLoader.LoadMetadataForReferencedProjects
member.summary: Determines if metadata from existing output assemblies is loaded instead of opening referenced projects. If the referenced project is already opened, the metadata will not be loaded. If the metadata assembly cannot be found the referenced project will be opened instead.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectLoader.SkipUnrecognizedProjects
member.summary:
Determines if unrecognized projects are skipped when solutions or projects are opened.
A project is unrecognized if it either has a) an invalid file path, b) a non-existent project file, c) has an unrecognized file extension or d) a file extension associated with an unsupported language.
If unrecognized projects cannot be skipped a corresponding exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectLoader.AssociateFileExtensionWithLanguage(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Associates a project file extension with a language name.
member.param: The project file extension to associate with .
The language to associate with . This value should typically be taken from .

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectLoader.LoadSolutionInfoAsync(System.String,System.IProgress{Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectLoadProgress},Microsoft.Build.Framework.ILogger,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Loads the for the specified solution file, including all projects referenced by the solution file and all the projects referenced by the project files.
member.param: The path to the solution file to be loaded. This may be an absolute path or a path relative to the current working directory.
An optional that will receive updates as the solution is loaded.
An optional that will log msbuild results.
An optional to allow cancellation of this operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectLoader.LoadProjectInfoAsync(System.String,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectMap,System.IProgress{Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectLoadProgress},Microsoft.Build.Framework.ILogger,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Loads the from the specified project file and all referenced projects. The first in the result corresponds to the specified project file.
member.param: The path to the project file to be loaded. This may be an absolute path or a path relative to the current working directory.
An optional that will be used to resolve project references to existing projects. This is useful when populating a custom .
An optional that will receive updates as the project is loaded.
An optional that will log msbuild results.
An optional to allow cancellation of this operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectLoader.Worker._requestedProjectPaths
member.summary: An ordered list of paths to project files that should be loaded. In the case of a solution, this is the list of project file paths in the solution.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectLoader.Worker._globalProperties
member.summary: Global MSBuild properties to set when loading projects.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectLoader.Worker._projectMap
member.summary: Map of s, project paths, and output file paths.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectLoader.Worker._progress
member.summary: Progress reporter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectLoader.Worker._requestedProjectOptions
member.summary: Provides options for how failures should be reported when loading requested project files.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectLoader.Worker._discoveredProjectOptions
member.summary: Provides options for how failures should be reported when loading any discovered project files.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectLoader.Worker._preferMetadataForReferencesOfDiscoveredProjects
member.summary: When true, metadata is preferred for any project reference unless the referenced project is already loaded because it was requested.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectLoader.Worker.ResolvedReferencesBuilder
member.summary: This type helps produces lists of metadata and project references. Initially, it contains a list of metadata references. As project references are added, the metadata references that match those project references are removed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectLoader.Worker.ResolvedReferencesBuilder._metadataReferences
member.summary: The full list of s.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectLoader.Worker.ResolvedReferencesBuilder._pathToIndicesMap
member.summary: A map of every metadata reference file paths to a set of indices whether than file path exists in the list. It is expected that there may be multiple metadata references for the same file path in the case where multiple extern aliases are provided.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectLoader.Worker.ResolvedReferencesBuilder._indicesToRemove
member.summary: A set of indeces into that are to be removed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectLoader.Worker.ResolvedReferencesBuilder.Contains(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if a metadata reference with the given file path is contained within this list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectLoader.Worker.ResolvedReferencesBuilder.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the metadata reference with the given file path from this list.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.Conversions
member.summary: Handles conversions from MSBuild values.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.DocumentFileInfo
member.summary: Represents a source file that is part of a project file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.DocumentFileInfo.FilePath
member.summary: The absolute path to the document file on disk.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.DocumentFileInfo.LogicalPath
member.summary: A fictional path to the document, relative to the project. The document may not actually exist at this location, and is used to represent linked documents. This includes the file name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.DocumentFileInfo.IsLinked
member.summary: True if the document has a logical path that differs from its absolute file path.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.DocumentFileInfo.IsGenerated
member.summary: True if the file was generated during build.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.DocumentFileInfo.SourceCodeKind
member.summary: The of this document.

member.summary: Create a from a ProjectReference node in the MSBuild file.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.IProjectFile
member.summary: Represents a project file loaded from disk.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.IProjectFile.FilePath
member.summary: The path to the project file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.IProjectFile.Log
member.summary: The error message produced when a failure occurred attempting to access the project file. If a failure occurred the project file info will be inaccessible.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.IProjectFile.GetProjectFileInfosAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets project file information asynchronously. Note that this can produce multiple instances of if the project is multi-targeted: one for each target framework.

member.summary: Gets the corresponding extension for a source file of a given kind.

member.summary: Add a metadata reference to a project file.

member.summary: Remove a metadata reference from a project file.

member.summary: Save the current state of the project file to disk.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectFile.GetAbsolutePathRelativeToProject(System.String)
member.summary: Resolves the given path that is possibly relative to the project directory.
member.remarks: The resulting path is absolute but might not be normalized.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectFileInfo
member.summary: Provides information about a project that has been loaded from disk and built with MSBuild. If the project is multi-targeting, this represents the information from a single target framework.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectFileInfo.Language
member.summary: The language of this project.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectFileInfo.FilePath
member.summary: The path to the project file for this project.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectFileInfo.OutputFilePath
member.summary: The path to the output file this project generates.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectFileInfo.OutputRefFilePath
member.summary: The path to the reference assembly output file this project generates.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectFileInfo.DefaultNamespace
member.summary: The default namespace of the project ("" if not defined, which means global namespace), or null if it is unknown or not applicable.
member.remarks: Right now VB doesn't have the concept of "default namespace". But we conjure one in workspace by assigning the value of the project's root namespace to it. So various feature can choose to use it for their own purpose. In the future, we might consider officially exposing "default namespace" for VB project (e.g. through a "defaultnamespace" msbuild property)

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectFileInfo.TargetFramework
member.summary: The target framework of this project. This takes the form of the 'short name' form used by NuGet (e.g. net46, netcoreapp2.0, etc.)

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectFileInfo.CommandLineArgs
member.summary: The command line args used to compile the project.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectFileInfo.Documents
member.summary: The source documents.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectFileInfo.AdditionalDocuments
member.summary: The additional documents.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectFileInfo.AnalyzerConfigDocuments
member.summary: The analyzer config documents.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectFileInfo.ProjectReferences
member.summary: References to other projects.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectFileInfo.Log
member.summary: The error message produced when a failure occurred attempting to get the info. If a failure occurred some or all of the information may be inaccurate or incomplete.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectFileLoaderRegistry.AssociateFileExtensionWithLanguage(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Associates a project file extension with a language name.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectFileReference
member.summary: Represents a reference to another project file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectFileReference.Path
member.summary: The path on disk to the other project file. This path may be relative to the referencing project's file or an absolute path.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectFileReference.Aliases
member.summary: The aliases assigned to this reference, if any.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectLoadOperation
member.summary: Various operations that occur during a project load.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectLoadOperation.Evaluate
member.summary: Represents the MSBuild evaluation of a project. This occurs before to evalute the project file before any tasks are executed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectLoadOperation.Build
member.summary: Represents the MSBuild design-time build of a project. This build does not produce any any compiled binaries, but computes the information need to compile the project, such as compiler flags, source files and references.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectLoadOperation.Resolve
member.summary: Represents a resolution step that occurs after the MSBuild design-time build. This step performs final logic to resolve metadata and project references and produces the information needed to populate a .

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectLoadProgress
member.summary: Provides details as a project is loaded.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectLoadProgress.FilePath
member.summary: The project for which progress is being reported.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectLoadProgress.Operation
member.summary: The operation that has just completed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectLoadProgress.TargetFramework
member.summary: The target framework of the project being built or resolved. This property is only valid for SDK-style projects during the operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectLoadProgress.ElapsedTime
member.summary: The amount of time elapsed for this operation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectMap
member.summary: A map of projects that can be optionally used with when loading a project into a custom . To use, pass to .

member.summary: A map of project path to s. Note that there can be multiple s per project path if the project is multi-targeted -- one for each target framework.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectMap._projectPathToProjectInfosMap
member.summary: A map of project path to s. Note that there can be multiple s per project path if the project is multi-targeted -- one for each target framework.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectMap._projectIdToOutputFilePathMap
member.summary: A map of to the output file of the project (if any).

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MSBuild.ProjectMap._projectIdToOutputRefFilePathMap
member.summary: A map of to the output ref file of the project (if any).
